treatment.description: Basal leaves base typically reddish. Perianth broadly campanulate; petals sharply bent at gland. 2n = 30.
treatment.habitat: grassy margins of wet meadows and under pines
treatment.discussion: Calochortus longebarbatus var. peckii is a triploid that bears only sterile anthers and reproduces only vegetatively through division of the bulb. It is found in the Ochoco Mountains.
